intro: Kraenzlinella phrynoglossa, commonly known as the purple-flowered kraenzlinella, is a species of flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple and pink. The plant has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and leaves that are often arranged in a rosette pattern. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species.
